page.title: 07SESSAY - A LIVELY VILLAGE
page.content: There have been 2 important ceremonies held at Sessay Village Hall in the past year. Firstly, Sessay was adjudged the{ {winning village}in the{Best-Kept {Village Competition}organised by the Yorkshire Rural Community Council. We were presented with a wrought-ironwork sign set on an oak post (to keep until next competition in 1987) and an oak seat as a permanent commemoration. After the ceremony villagers and guests had a sumptious tea. We are all very proud to have won as there are many other pretty villages nearby. There was more celebration for{Sessay} {WI's 60th anniversary}when the national President of the Federation of WIs attended a party and then planted a cherry tree on the site of an old elm which had to be felled because of Dutch Elm Disease.
